  b: 2.0

```{r params, include=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
a <- params$a
b <- params$b
```

## Area Under Standard Normal Curve

Here we find the area under the curve between $z=`r a`$ and $z=`r b`$. We find the left tail area up to the right most z-value, then the left tail area up to thte left most z-value.... This is the most important thing I have ever done...!!!

```{r area, echo=FALSE}
dat <- data.frame(x=c(-3.5, 3.5))
ggplot(dat, aes(x=x)) +
  stat_function(fun=dnorm) +
  stat_function(fun=dnorm, xlim = c(a,b), geom="area", fill="blue", alpha=0.3) +
  labs(x = "z", y = "") +
  geom_hline(yintercept=0) +
  scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(-3, 3, by = 1.0)) +
  scale_y_continuous(breaks = seq(0, .4, by = 0.2)) +
  annotate("text", x = b, y = -0.01, label = sprintf("z=%s", b)) +
  annotate("text", x = a, y = -0.01, label = sprintf("z=%s", a))
```
